Uses of Package
coreapi

  • Packages that use coreapi 
    Package Description
    apihttp  
    com.example.accessingdatamysql  
    commands  
    coreapi  
    data  
    filepersistence  
    terminalcli  
  • Classes in coreapi used by apihttp 
    Class Description
    Cafeteria
    Class representing a Cafeteria with associated orders and its own stock of products.
    InsufficientStockException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to add a certain amount of a product to an order, but there isn't enough quantity of that product in stock at the current cafeteria.
    InvalidDateException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to add a invalid date.
    Order
    This interface represents a regular order at a cafeteria.
    OrderService
    This class acts as a service provider and interface for the client to work with objects from the Order class.
    Product
    This interface is the handler for the usage of all products.
    ProductNotContainedInOrderException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to remove a product from an order, but said product does not exist in that order.
    UnreachableStatusException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to change the status of an order to a new one, but the conditions for that change are not met.
    User
    Implementation of the Product interface representing a menu comprised of multiple products.
  • Classes in coreapi used by com.example.accessingdatamysql 
    Class Description
    Card
    Class that represents the users' university card with its associated card number, DNI of the user to which it belongs and balance.
    Order
    This interface represents a regular order at a cafeteria.
    OrderService
    This class acts as a service provider and interface for the client to work with objects from the Order class.
    User
    Implementation of the Product interface representing a menu comprised of multiple products.
    WrongTransactionException
    This class of exception represents the situation in which a customer enters incorrect data when he is going to carry out a transaction, and therefore this cannot be carried out correctly.
  • Classes in coreapi used by commands 
    Class Description
    Product
    This interface is the handler for the usage of all products.
  • Classes in coreapi used by coreapi 
    Class Description
    Cafeteria
    Class representing a Cafeteria with associated orders and its own stock of products.
    InsufficientStockException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to add a certain amount of a product to an order, but there isn't enough quantity of that product in stock at the current cafeteria.
    InvalidDateException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to add a invalid date.
    Order
    This interface represents a regular order at a cafeteria.
    OrderStatus
    Representation of the possible states an order can be in.
    Product
    This interface is the handler for the usage of all products.
    ProductNotContainedInOrderException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to remove a product from an order, but said product does not exist in that order.
    UnreachableStatusException
    This exception class represents the situation where a client is trying to change the status of an order to a new one, but the conditions for that change are not met.
    WrongTransactionException
    This class of exception represents the situation in which a customer enters incorrect data when he is going to carry out a transaction, and therefore this cannot be carried out correctly.
